div.bibl: Dziennik Zwiazkowy, Feb. 6, 1917. POLISH NATIONAL ALLIANCE TO PRESIDENT WILSON

body.p: At yesterday's meeting of the Central Board of Directors it was resolved to send the following telegram to President Wilson:

In the present great crisis involving the United States, the members of our organization, numbering one hundred and twenty thousand, are with you to a man in supporting your manly stand for the vindication of the rights, honor, and dignity of our country. They are ready and willing at all times to render any service and make any sacrifice that their duty as American citizens
may require of them.
